nl_statement: Any finite group has a composition series. Moreover, its composition factors are unique, except for order and isomorphism. In other words, if $G = N_0 \triangleright N_1 \triangleright N_2 \triangleright \cdots \triangleright N_{m-1} \triangleright N_m = \{1\}$ and $G = K_0 \triangleright K_1 \triangleright K_2 \triangleright \cdots \triangleright K_{n-1} \triangleright K_n = \{1\}$ are any two composition series for $G$, then $m=n$ and there is a permutation $\alpha \in S_n$ such that $N_i/N_{i+1} \cong K_{\alpha(i)}/K_{\alpha(i+1)}$ for each $i$.

name: srdoty_alg_simple-gps_308
nl_statement: Galois proved that the alternating group $A_5$ is simple. Galois also showed that the symmetry group of the general quintic equation (degree 5 polynomial with arbitrary variable coefficients) is $S_5$. Assuming these facts, prove that the roots of a general quintic cannot be expressed in terms of radicals.

name: srdoty_alg_simple-gps_315
nl_statement: Prove that if $K$ is a normal subgroup of a group $G$ and $\pi: G \to G/K$ is the canonical homomorphism, then the mapping $H \mapsto \pi(H)=H/K$ gives a bijective correspondence between the subgroups of $G$ that contain $K$ and the subgroups of $G/K$. Furthermore, in this correspondence $H \triangleleft G$ if and only if $H/K \triangleleft G/K$.

name: srdoty_alg_simple-gps_317
nl_statement: Show that if $G$ is a group of prime power order $p^r$ for a prime $p$ and $r \ge 1$ then the composition factors of $G$ are all isomorphic to $\mathbb{Z}/p\mathbb{Z}$.

name: srdoty_alg_simple-gps_359
nl_statement: Every finite simple group is isomorphic to one of the following groups: (1) A cyclic group of prime order. (2) An alternating group of degree at least 5. (3) A simple group of Lie type, including both (4) the classical Lie groups, namely the simple groups related to the projective special linear, unitary, symplectic, or orthogonal transformations over a finite field; (5) the exceptional and twisted groups of Lie type (including the Tits group). (6) One of the 26 sporadic simple groups.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_249
nl_statement: Let $N$ be a normal subgroup of a group $G$. Then the coset multiplication rule $(aN)(bN) = (ab)N$ (for any $a,b \in G$) is a well-defined binary operation on the set $G/N$ of left cosets. With respect to this multiplication, $G/N$ is a group, with identity element $1N = N$. The inverse of $aN$ is $a^{-1}N$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_412
nl_statement: Let $f:G \to H$ be a homomorphism from a group $(G,*)$ to a group $(H,\#)$. Then: (1) $f(e_G) = e_H$; i.e., $f$ maps the identity of $G$ onto the identity of $H$. (2) The inverse of $f(a)$ in $H$ is the image of the inverse of $a$; i.e., if $a'$ is the inverse of $a$ in $G$ then the inverse of $f(a)$ in $H$ is $f(a)' = f(a')$. (3) If $f$ is a bijection, then $f^{-1}: H \to G$ is also a homomorphism.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_498
nl_statement: Let $G$, $G'$ be groups and $f:G \to G'$ a group homomorphism. Set $K=\ker f$ and $I=\operatorname{im} f = f(G)$. Then $f = \iota \circ \overline{f} \circ \pi,$ where $\iota: I \to G'$ is the inclusion map (coming from the inclusion $I \subset G'$), $\pi: G \to G/K$ is the canonical homomorphism, and $\overline{f}: G/K \to I$ is the induced map defined by $\overline{f}(aK) = f(a)$ for $a\in G$. In particular, $G/K \cong I$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_596
nl_statement: If $K$ is a given normal subgroup of a group $G$, then there exists a homomorphism $f: G \to G'$ (for some group $G'$) such that $K= \ker f$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_627
nl_statement: If $H \triangleleft\, G$, $K \triangleleft\, G$, and $H \subset K$ then: (1) $(K/H) \triangleleft\, (G/H)$. (2) $(G/H)/(K/H) \cong G/K$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_288
nl_statement: Show that the trivial subgroup is always a normal subgroup of any group $G$. Also, show that $G \triangleleft\, G$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_300
nl_statement: Show that if $H$ is a subgroup of order $n$ in a group $G$ and $H$ is the only subgroup of order $n$, then $H \triangleleft\, G$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_303
nl_statement: Show that a subgroup $H$ of a group $G$ is normal if and only if it satisfies the condition: $ab \in H \iff ba \in H$, for all $a,b \in G$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_314
nl_statement: Let $\mathrm{D}_n$ be the dihedral group on $n$ vertices and let $R$ be its rotation subgroup. Prove that $R \triangleleft\, \mathrm{D}_n$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_341
nl_statement: Show that the set $G$ of all real $2 \times 2$ matrices of the form $\left( \begin{matrix} a&b\\ 0&c \end{matrix} \right)$ is a subgroup of $\mathrm{GL}(2)$. Let $N$ be the set of all matrices of the form $\left( \begin{matrix} 1&b\\ 0&1 \end{matrix} \right).$ Prove that $N \triangleleft\, G$. (Note that you need to show it is a subgroup as well as prove that it is normal.)

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_354
nl_statement: Show that $n\mathbb{Z} = \{nk \mid k \in \mathbb{Z}\}$ is a normal subgroup of the additive group $\mathbb{Z}$ of integers, and that $\mathbb{Z}/n\mathbb{Z} \cong \mathbb{Z}_n$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_360
nl_statement: Show that if $H, K$ are subgroups of a group $G$ such that $K \triangleleft\, G$ then $H \cap K \triangleleft\, H$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_675
nl_statement: (Injectivity test for homomorphisms) Prove that if $f: G \to H$ is a group homomorphism with kernel $K$ then $f$ is injective if and only if $K$ is the trivial subgroup.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_679
nl_statement: Prove that the canonical homomorphism $\pi: G \to G/K$ is a homomorphism; i.e., show that $\pi(ab) = \pi(a)\pi(b)$ for all $a,b$ in $G$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_687
nl_statement: (Homomorphic images of subgroups are subgroups) Show that if $f: G \to G'$ is a group homomorphism and $H < G$ then $f(H) < G'$, where $f(H) = \{f(x) \mid x \in H\}$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_697
nl_statement: Define a map $f \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{C}^{\times}$ by $f(x) = e^{2\pi i x}$ for any $x \in \mathbb{R}$. (Here $\mathbb{R}$ is the additive group of real numbers.) Show that the quotient group $\mathbb{R}/\mathbb{Z}$ is isomorphic to the circle group $\{e^{2\pi i x} \mid x \in \mathbb{R} \}$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_720
nl_statement: Prove that $\mathrm{SL}(n) \triangleleft\, \mathrm{GL}(n)$ and $\mathrm{GL}(n)/\mathrm{SL}(n) \cong \mathbb{R}^{\times}$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_723
nl_statement: Prove that $\mathrm{SO}(n) \triangleleft\, \mathrm{O}(n)$ and $\mathrm{O}(n)/\mathrm{SO}(n) \cong \mathbb{Z}^{\times}$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_726
nl_statement: If $K \triangleleft\, G$ and $H < G$ then $H \cap K \triangleleft\, H$, $HK$ is a subgroup of $G$, and $H/(H\cap K) \cong HK/K$.

name: srdoty_alg_quotient-gps_730
nl_statement: If $H \triangleleft\, G$, $K \triangleleft\, G$, and $H \subset K$ then $(K/H) \triangleleft\, (G/H)$ and $(G/H)/(K/H) \cong G/K$.

name: srdoty_alg_symmetry_574
nl_statement: Let \(D_4\) be the symmetry group of a square with vertices labeled \(1,2,3,4\) counterclockwise. Let \(r\in D_4\) be the rotation by \(90^\circ\) (sending \(1\mapsto 2\)), and let \(d_2\in D_4\) be the reflection across the diagonal joining vertices \(2\) and \(4\). Prove that \(r d_2 r = d_2\).

name: srdoty_alg_symmetry_588
nl_statement: Let \(D_3\) be the dihedral group of symmetries of a regular triangle, and let \(S_3\) be the symmetric group on three letters. Show that \(D_3 \cong S_3\).

name: srdoty_alg_symmetry_602
nl_statement: Let \(D_n\) be the dihedral group of a regular \(n\)-gon (\(n\ge 3\)) with rotation \(r\) of order \(n\) and a reflection \(d\). Show that \(r d r = d\).

name: srdoty_alg_symmetry_718
nl_statement: Let \(T\) be the group of proper symmetries (rotations) of a regular tetrahedron. Prove that \(T \cong A_4\).

name: srdoty_alg_symmetry_723
nl_statement: Let \(G\) be the full symmetry group (including reflections) of a regular tetrahedron. Prove that \(G \cong S_4\).

name: srdoty_alg_symmetry_743
nl_statement: Let \(D_n\) be the dihedral group of a regular \(n\)-gon (\(n\ge 3\)). Let \(r\) be the rotation by \(2\pi/n\) and let \(h\) be the reflection across the horizontal axis. Prove that \(rhr=h\) by giving an algebraic argument with matrices (represent \(r\) by a rotation matrix and \(h\) by a suitable reflection matrix).

name: srdoty_alg_symmetry_760
nl_statement: Let \(F\) be a field. A permutation matrix in \(\mathrm{GL}_n(F)\) is an \(n\times n\) matrix obtained from the identity matrix by a permutation of its columns (equivalently, it has exactly one entry \(1\) in each row and each column, and all other entries are \(0\)). Prove that the symmetric group \(S_n\) is isomorphic to the subgroup of permutation matrices in \(\mathrm{GL}_n(F)\) via the map \(\alpha \mapsto P_\alpha\), where \(P_\alpha\) is the permutation matrix obtained by applying \(\alpha\in S_n\) to the columns of the identity matrix.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-approximate_2229
nl_statement: Let $\epsilon > 0$, let $p(z)$ be a nonconstant complex polynomial, or more generally a nonconstant power series converging in $\{ z \in \mathbb{C} : \lvert z - z_0\rvert < \epsilon \}$, and suppose $p(z_0) \not= 0$. Then there exists a $w \in \{ z \in \mathbb{C} : \lvert z - z_0\rvert < \epsilon \}$ such that $\lvert p(w)\rvert < \lvert p(z_0)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-approximate_948
nl_statement: Suppose $f_n \to f$ uniformly on $[a,b]$ and $g$ is continuous on $[a,b]$. Prove that $\lim_{n\to\infty} \int_a^b f_n g = \int_a^b f g .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-approximate_954
nl_statement: Define the hyperbolic sine and cosine functions by $\sinh(x) := \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{x^{2k+1}}{(2k+1)!} \qquad and \qquad \cosh(x) := \sum_{k=0}^\infty \frac{x^{2k}}{(2k)!} .$ Prove that the power series for $\sinh(x)$ and $\cosh(x)$ converge for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-approximate_1003
nl_statement: Suppose $f_n \colon [0,1] \to \mathbb{R}$ are monotone increasing functions and suppose that $\sum_{n=1}^\infty f_n$ converges pointwise. Prove that $\sum_{n=1}^\infty f_n$ converges uniformly.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-approximate_1640
nl_statement: Let $f \colon \mathbb{C} \to \mathbb{C}$ be analytic and not constant. Prove that $f(\mathbb{C})$ is open.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-approximate_1698
nl_statement: Prove that $e^{\overline{z}} = \overline{e^z}$ and that $\sin(\overline{z}) = \overline{\sin(z)}$, $\cos(\overline{z}) = \overline{\cos(z)}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-approximate_2409
nl_statement: Prove that if $p(z)$ is a nonconstant power series converging in $\{ z \in \mathbb{C} : \lvert z - z_0\rvert < \epsilon \}$ and $p(z_0) \not= 0$, then there exists $w$ in that disk with $\lvert p(w)\rvert < \lvert p(z_0)\rvert$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-approximate_2419
nl_statement: Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be open and $z_0 \in U$. Suppose $f : U \to \mathbb{C}$ is analytic and $f(z_0) = 0$. Show that there exists an $\epsilon > 0$ such that either $f(z) \not= 0$ for all $z$ with $0 < \lvert z\rvert < \epsilon$ or $f(z) = 0$ for all $z \in \{ z \in \mathbb{C} : \lvert z - z_0\rvert < \epsilon \}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-approximate_3996
nl_statement: Suppose $f$ is differentiable on $(a,b)$ and $f'(x) \ge 0$ for all $x \in (a,b)$. Prove that $f$ is increasing on $(a,b)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-approximate_4066
nl_statement: Suppose $f$ is $k$-times continuously differentiable on $[a,b]$. Prove that there exist polynomials $p_n$ such that $\sum_{j=0}^k \lVert f^{(j)} - p_n^{(j)}\rVert_{[a,b]} \to 0 \quad as n \to \infty .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_202
nl_statement: Let $S \subset \mathbb{R}$, let $c$ be a cluster point of $S$, let $f \colon S \to \mathbb{R}$ be a function, and let $L \in \mathbb{R}$. Then $f(x) \to L$ as $x \to c$ if and only if for every sequence $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ such that $x_n \in S \setminus \{c\}$ for all $n$, and such that $\lim_{n\to\infty} x_n = c$, we have that the sequence $\bigl\{ f(x_n) \bigr\}_{n=1}^\infty$ converges to $L$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_665
nl_statement: Prove the following stronger version of one direction of \emph{the sequence characterization of limits}. Suppose $S \subset \mathbb{R}$, $c$ is a cluster point of $S$, and $f \colon S \to \mathbb{R}$ is a function. Suppose that there exists an $L \in \mathbb{R}$ such that for every sequence $\{x_n\}_{n=1}^\infty$ in $S \setminus \{c\}$ with $\lim_{n\to\infty} x_n = c$, the sequence $\bigl\{ f(x_n) \bigr\}_{n=1}^\infty$ converges to $L$. Then show that the limit of $f(x)$ as $x \to c$ exists.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_1343
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon S \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous, $S \subset \mathbb{R}$, and $c \in S$. Show that for every sequence $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ in $S$ with $x_n \to c$, we have $f(x_n) \to f(c)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_1411
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon S \to \mathbb{R}$ and $c \in S$. Prove that $f$ is continuous at $c$ if and only if for every sequence $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ in $S$ such that $x_n \to c$, we have $f(x_n) \to f(c)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_1454
nl_statement: Let $S \subset \mathbb{R}$ and $c \in S$. Let $f \colon S \to \mathbb{R}$ be continuous at $c$, and let $g \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be continuous at $f(c)$. Prove that $g \circ f$ is continuous at $c$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_1543
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous. Let $A \subset \mathbb{R}$ be an interval. Prove that $f(A)$ is an interval.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_1559
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous on an interval $(a,b)$. Suppose $f(c) < 0$ and $f(d) > 0$ for some $a < c < d < b$. Prove that there exists a $x \in (c,d)$ such that $f(x) = 0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_1579
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous, $f(a) < 0$, and $f(b) > 0$. Show that there exists $c \in (a,b)$ such that $f(c) = 0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_2381
nl_statement: [Challenging] Let $f \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be a polynomial of degree $d \geq 2$. Show that $f$ is not Lipschitz continuous.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_2474
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous. Prove that $f$ is uniformly continuous on every compact subset of $\mathbb{R}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_2582
nl_statement: Let $P \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be a polynomial. Show that $\lim_{x\to\infty} P(x) = \begin{cases} \infty, & if the degree of $P$ is odd and the leading coefficient is positive, \\ -\infty, & if the degree of $P$ is odd and the leading coefficient is negative, \end{cases}$ and that $\lim_{x\to-\infty} P(x) = \begin{cases} -\infty, & if the degree of $P$ is odd and the leading coefficient is positive, \\ \infty, & if the degree of $P$ is odd and the leading coefficient is negative. \end{cases}$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_2655
nl_statement: Let $P \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be a polynomial. Show that $\lim_{x\to\infty} P(x) = \begin{cases} \infty, & if the degree of $P$ is even and the leading coefficient is positive, \\ \infty, & if the degree of $P$ is even and the leading coefficient is negative, \end{cases}$ and that $\lim_{x\to-\infty} P(x) = \begin{cases} \infty, & if the degree of $P$ is even and the leading coefficient is positive, \\ \infty, & if the degree of $P$ is even and the leading coefficient is negative. \end{cases}$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-contfunc_3229
nl_statement: Suppose $S \subset \mathbb{R}$, and $f \colon S \to \mathbb{R}$ is an increasing function. Prove: If $c$ is a cluster point of $S \cap (c,\infty)$, then $\lim\limits_{x\to c^+} f(x) < \infty$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_500
nl_statement: Show that for every set $X$, the discrete metric ($d(x,y) = 1$ if $x\not=y$ and $d(x,x) = 0$) does give a metric space $(X,d)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_526
nl_statement: Suppose $(X,d)$ is a metric space and $\varphi \colon [0,\infty) \to \mathbb{R}$ is an increasing function such that $\varphi(t) \geq 0$ for all $t$ and $\varphi(t) = 0$ if and only if $t=0$. Also suppose $\varphi$ is subadditive, that is, $\varphi(s+t) \leq \varphi(s)+\varphi(t)$. Show that with $d'(x,y) := \varphi\bigl(d(x,y)\bigr)$, we obtain a new metric space $(X,d')$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_540
nl_statement: Let $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ be metric spaces. Show that $(X \times Y,d)$ with $d\bigl( (x_1,y_1), (x_2,y_2) \bigr) := d_X(x_1,x_2) + d_Y(y_1,y_2)$ is a metric space.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_544
nl_statement: Let $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ be metric spaces. Show that $(X \times Y,d)$ with $d\bigl( (x_1,y_1), (x_2,y_2) \bigr) := \max \bigl\{ d_X(x_1,x_2) , d_Y(y_1,y_2) \bigr\}$ is a metric space.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_596
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a nonempty metric space and $S \subset X$ a subset. Prove: $S$ is bounded if and only if for every $p \in X$, there exists a $B > 0$ such that $d(p,x) \leq B$ for all $x \in S$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_602
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a nonempty metric space and $S \subset X$ a subset. Prove: If $S$ is bounded, then there exists a $B>0$ and $p \in S$ such that $d(p,x) \leq B$ for all $x \in S$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_638
nl_statement: Let $S \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ be a nonempty subset and for $x,y \in S$ define $d(x,y) := \max \{ \lvert x_1-y_1 \rvert,\lvert x_2-y_2 \rvert,\cdots,\lvert x_n-y_n \rvert \}$. Show that $(S,d)$ is a metric space.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_1322
nl_statement: Take $\mathbb{Q}$ with the standard metric, $d(x,y) = \lvert x-y \rvert$, as our metric space. Prove that $\mathbb{Q}$ is a disconnected metric space. That is, show that there exist two open sets $U$ and $V$ such that $U \cap V = \emptyset$, $U$ and $V$ are nonempty, and $U \cup V = \mathbb{Q}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_1348
nl_statement: Prove that in a metric space, $S$ is open if and only if for every $p \in S$ there is an $\epsilon > 0$ such that $B(p,\epsilon) \subset S$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_1547
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a metric space and $\{ U_i \}$ a family of open sets in $X$. Prove that $\partial\biggl(\bigcup_i U_i\biggr) \subset \bigcup_i \partial U_i$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_1565
nl_statement: For each natural number $n$, let $A_n \subset X$ be a closed set in a metric space $X$. Prove that $\bigcup_{n=1}^\infty A_n$ is closed if $A_1 \subset A_2 \subset A_3 \subset \cdots$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_2033
nl_statement: Suppose $(X,d)$ is a compact metric space and $K \subset X$. Prove that $K$ is closed if and only if $K$ is complete in the subspace metric.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_2043
nl_statement: Suppose $(X,d)$ is a compact metric space and $K \subset X$. Prove that $K$ is compact as a subset of $(X,d)$ if and only if $K$ is compact as a subset of itself with the subspace metric.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_2175
nl_statement: Let $X$ be a metric space. Suppose $\{S_n\}_{n=1}^\infty$ is a sequence of nonempty compact sets such that $S_n \supset S_{n+1}$ for all $n$. Prove that $\bigcap_{n=1}^\infty S_n$ is nonempty.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_2313
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a metric space. Suppose $K \subset X$ is compact. Prove that $K$ is the union of finitely many open balls of radius $\epsilon$, for every $\epsilon > 0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_2330
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a metric space. Suppose $K \subset X$ is compact. Prove that there exists a finite $\epsilon$-net for $K$, for every $\epsilon > 0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_2376
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a metric space, $S \subset X$, and $A \subset X$. Suppose $S$ is totally bounded. Show that $A \cap S$ is totally bounded.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_2468
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a complete metric space, $Y$ be any metric space, and suppose $S \subset X$ is totally bounded. Let $f \colon S \to Y$ be uniformly continuous. Prove that $\{ f(x) : x \in S \}$ is totally bounded.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_2523
nl_statement: Let $X$ be a metric space and $C \subset \mathcal{P}(X)$ the set of nonempty compact subsets of $X$. Show that $(C,d_H)$ is a metric space.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_3049
nl_statement: Let $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ be metric spaces, $S \subset X$, $p \in X$ a cluster point of $S$, and let $f \colon S \to Y$ be a function. Then $f(x)$ converges to $L \in Y$ as $x$ goes to $p$ if and only if for every sequence $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ in $S \setminus \{p\}$ such that $\lim_{n\to\infty} x_n = p$, the sequence $\bigl\{ f(x_n) \bigr\}_{n=1}^\infty$ converges to $L$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_3065
nl_statement: Let $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ be metric spaces. Prove that if $f \colon X \to Y$ is continuous at $p \in X$, and if $\{x_n\}$ is a sequence in $X$ converging to $p$, then $\{f(x_n)\}$ converges to $f(p)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_3131
nl_statement: A continuous $f \colon X \to Y$ between metric spaces $(X,d_X)$ and $(Y,d_Y)$ need not be uniformly continuous. Prove: If $X$ is compact, then every continuous $f \colon X \to Y$ is uniformly continuous.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_3181
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a compact metric space, let $C(X,\mathbb{R})$ be the set of continuous functions $X \to \mathbb{R}$. Consider the following metrics: $d_1(f,g) := \int_X \lvert f-g \rvert d\mu, \qquad d_\infty(f,g) := \sup_{x \in X} \lvert f(x)-g(x) \rvert .$ Show that $d_\infty$ induces a topology stronger than or equal to that induced by $d_1$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_3274
nl_statement: Let $f \colon [0,1] \to \mathbb{R}$ be continuous and define $F(x) := \int_0^x f(t) dt$. Prove that $F$ is uniformly continuous on $[0,1]$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_3622
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a metric space. Suppose $\{f_n\}$ is a sequence of continuous functions $X \to \mathbb{R}$ that converges uniformly to $f \colon X \to \mathbb{R}$. Prove that $f$ is continuous.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_3665
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon X \to X$ is a contraction, and $(X,d)$ is a metric space such that there exists a $B > 0$ with $d(f(x),f(y)) \leq B \cdot d(x,y)$ for all $x,y \in X$. Prove that $f$ has a unique fixed point.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-metric_3672
nl_statement: Suppose $(X,d)$ is a nonempty complete metric space, $f \colon X \to X$ is a mapping, and denote by $f^n$ the $n$th iterate of $f$. Suppose for every $n$ there exists a $k_n > 0$ such that $d\bigl(f^n(x),f^n(y)\bigr) \leq k_n d(x,y)$ for all $x,y \in X$, where $\sum_{n=1}^\infty k_n < \infty$. Prove that $f$ has a unique fixed point in $X$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_823
nl_statement: Suppose $R\subset \mathbb{R}^n$ is a closed rectangle with one side of length $0$. For every bounded function $f\colon R\to \mathbb{R}$, show that $f$ is Riemann integrable on $R$ and $\int_R f = 0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_949
nl_statement: Suppose $f\colon [-1,1]\times[-1,1]\to \mathbb{R}$ is Riemann integrable and satisfies $f(x)=-f(-x)$ for all $(x,y)\in [-1,1]^2$. Using the definition of the Riemann integral, prove that $\int_{[-1,1]\times[-1,1]} f = 0 .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_1353
nl_statement: Let $R=[a,b]\times[c,d]$ and let $g\colon [a,b]\to \mathbb{R}$ and $h\colon [c,d]\to \mathbb{R}$ be continuous. Define $f(x,y)=g(x)h(y)$. Prove that $\int_R f = \left(\int_a^b g\right)\left(\int_c^d h\right) .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_1373
nl_statement: Let $R=[a,b]\times[c,d]$ and let $g\colon [a,b]\to \mathbb{R}$ be integrable. Define $f(x,y)=g(x)$. Prove that $\int_R f = (d-c)\int_a^b g .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_1932
nl_statement: Suppose $X\subset \mathbb{R}^n$ is such that for every $\epsilon>0$ there exists a set $Y\supset X$ with $m^*(Y)\le \epsilon$, where $m^*$ is the outer measure on $\mathbb{R}^n$. Prove that $X$ has measure zero (that is, $m^*(X)=0$).

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_1970
nl_statement: Let $U\subset \mathbb{R}^n$ be open and let $f\colon U\to \mathbb{R}$ be continuous. Let $G=\{(x,f(x))\in \mathbb{R}^{n+1}: x\in U\}$ be the graph of $f$. Show that $G$ has measure zero in $\mathbb{R}^{n+1}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_1977
nl_statement: Given a closed rectangle $R\subset \mathbb{R}^n$ and $\epsilon>0$, show that there exist closed cubes $C_1,\ldots,C_k$ such that $R\subset C_1\cup\cdots\cup C_k$ and $\sum_{j=1}^k V(C_j)\le V(R)+\epsilon$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_2067
nl_statement: Let $m^*$ be the outer measure on $\mathbb{R}^n$ defined by $m^*(S)=\inf\Big\{\sum_{j=1}^{\infty} V(R_j) : S\subset \bigcup_{j=1}^{\infty} R_j, R_j open rectangles\Big\}.$ Define instead $\mu^*(S)=\inf\Big\{\sum_{j\in I} V(R_j) : S\subset \bigcup_{j\in I} R_j, I finite or countably infinite, R_j open rectangles\Big\}.$ Prove that for every $S\subset \mathbb{R}^n$, $\mu^*(S)=m^*(S)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_2077
nl_statement: Let $m^*$ be the outer measure on $\mathbb{R}^n$ defined via coverings by countably many open rectangles. Prove that for any two subsets $A,B\subset \mathbb{R}^n$, we have $m^*(A\cup B)\le m^*(A)+m^*(B)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_2082
nl_statement: Let $m^*$ be the outer measure on $\mathbb{R}^n$. Suppose $A,B\subset \mathbb{R}^n$ with $m^*(B)=0$. Prove that $m^*(A\cup B)=m^*(A)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_2087
nl_statement: Let $m^*$ be the outer measure on $\mathbb{R}^n$. Suppose $R_1,\ldots,R_n$ are pairwise disjoint open rectangles. Prove that $m^*\Bigl(\bigcup_{k=1}^n R_k\Bigr)=\sum_{k=1}^n m^*(R_k).$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_2504
nl_statement: Suppose $R \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ is a closed rectangle and $f\colon R\to \mathbb{R}$ is Riemann integrable. Show that $\lvert f\rvert$ is Riemann integrable on $R$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_2929
nl_statement: Prove that every bounded convex set in $\mathbb{R}^n$ is Jordan measurable.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_3775
nl_statement: Suppose $U\subset \mathbb{R}^n$ is open and $S\subset U$ is a compact Jordan measurable set. Show that there exist finitely many closed rectangles $P_1,\ldots,P_k$ contained in $U$ such that $S\subset \bigcup_{j=1}^k P_j$ and the interiors are mutually disjoint; that is, $P_j^{\circ}\cap P_\ell^{\circ}=\emptyset$ whenever $j\ne \ell$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_3803
nl_statement: Prove the following version of the theorem: \emph{Suppose $f \colon \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is a Riemann integrable compactly supported function. Suppose $K \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ is the support of $f$, $S$ is a compact set, and $g \colon \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^n$ is a function that when restricted to a neighborhood $U$ of $S$ is one-to-one and continuously differentiable, $g(S) = K$, and $J_g$ is never zero on $S$ (assume $J_g(x) = 0$ if $g$ is not differentiable at $x$, that is, when $x \notin U$). Here $J_g(x)=\det g'(x)$ denotes the Jacobian determinant. Then} $\int_{\mathbb{R}^{n}} f(x) dx = \int_{\mathbb{R}^n} f\bigl(g(x)\bigr) \lvert J_g(x)\rvert dx .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_3820
nl_statement: Prove the following version of the theorem: \emph{Suppose $S \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ is an open bounded Jordan measurable set, $g \colon S \to \mathbb{R}^n$ is a one-to-one continuously differentiable mapping such that $J_g$ is never zero on $S$, and such that $g(S)$ is bounded and Jordan measurable (it is also open). Suppose $f \colon g(S) \to \mathbb{R}$ is Riemann integrable. (Here $J_g(x)=\det g'(x)$ denotes the Jacobian determinant.) Then $f \circ g$ is Riemann integrable on $S$ and} $\int_{g(S)} f(x) dx = \int_S f\bigl(g(x)\bigr) \lvert J_g(x)\rvert dx .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-der_390
nl_statement: Let $n \in \mathbb{Z}$. Prove that the function $x \mapsto x^n$ is differentiable for all $x \neq 0$ if $n<0$ and for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$ if $n \ge 0$, and that $(x^n)' = n x^{n-1}$ (whenever defined).

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-der_402
nl_statement: Define $f \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ by $f(x)=x^2$ if $x \in \mathbb{Q}$ and $f(x)=0$ if $x \notin \mathbb{Q}$. Prove that $f$ is differentiable at $0$ but discontinuous at every $x \neq 0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-der_420
nl_statement: Prove that $\sin x$ is differentiable for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$ and that $\frac{d}{dx}\sin x = \cos x$ for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-der_478
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon I \to \mathbb{R}$ is differentiable at $c \in I$. Prove that there exist real numbers $a$ and $b$ such that for every $\epsilon>0$ there exists $\delta>0$ with $\lvert a+b(x-c)-f(x)\rvert \le \epsilon \lvert x-c\rvert$ whenever $x\in I$ and $\lvert x-c\rvert<\delta$. Equivalently, prove that there exists a function $g \colon I \to \mathbb{R}$ with $\lim_{x\to c}g(x)=0$ and $\lvert a+b(x-c)-f(x)\rvert= \lvert x-c\rvert g(x)$ for all $x\in I$ near $c$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-der_490
nl_statement:
Let $f,g \colon (a,b)	o \mathbb{R}$ be differentiable with $f'$ and $g'$ continuous on $(a,b)$. Let $c\in (a,b)$ with $f(c)=0$, $g(c)=0$, $g'(x)
eq 0$ for all $x\in (a,b)$, and $g(x)
eq 0$ for $x
eq c$. Assume $\lim_{x	o c} rac{f'(x)}{g'(x)}$ exists. Prove that $\displaystyle \lim_{x	o c} rac{f(x)}{g(x)}=\lim_{x	o c} rac{f'(x)}{g'(x)}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-der_506
nl_statement: Let $f \colon (a,b)\to \mathbb{R}$ be differentiable at $c\in(a,b)$ with $f(c)=0$ and $f'(c)>0$. Prove there exists $\delta>0$ such that $f(x)<0$ whenever $c-\delta<x<c$ and $f(x)>0$ whenever $c<x<c+\delta$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-der_1129
nl_statement: Let $f \colon (a,b)\to \mathbb{R}$ be continuous and differentiable on $(a,b)\setminus\{c\}$ for some $c\in(a,b)$. Assume $\lim_{x\to c} f'(x)=L$ exists. Prove that $f$ is differentiable at $c$ and $f'(c)=L$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-der_1142
nl_statement: Let $f \colon (0,1)\to \mathbb{R}$ be differentiable and suppose $f'$ is bounded on $(0,1)$. Prove that there exists a continuous function $g \colon [0,1)\to \mathbb{R}$ such that $g(x)=f(x)$ for all $x\in(0,1)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-der_1435
nl_statement: Let $p$ be a polynomial of degree $d$ and let $x_0\in\mathbb{R}$. Prove that the $d$th Taylor polynomial of $p$ at $x_0$ equals $p$ itself.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-funcs_393
nl_statement: Suppose $f_n \colon S \to \mathbb{R}$ converge uniformly to $f \colon S \to \mathbb{R}$ and $A \subset S$. Show that the restrictions $f_n\vert_A$ converge uniformly to $f\vert_A$ on $A$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-funcs_399
nl_statement: Suppose $f_n , g_n \colon A \to \mathbb{R}$ converge pointwise to $f$ and $g$ respectively. Show that $f_n+g_n$ converges pointwise to $f+g$ on $A$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-funcs_734
nl_statement: Let $f_n \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ be Riemann integrable and suppose $f_n \to f$ uniformly on $[a,b]$. Then $f$ is Riemann integrable and $\int_a^b f = \lim_{n\to\infty} \int_a^b f_n .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-funcs_1057
nl_statement: Let $\sum_{n=0}^\infty c_n (x-a)^n$ be a power series with radius of convergence $0<\rho\leq \infty$, and let $I \coloneqq (a-\rho,a+\rho)$ if $\rho<\infty$ or $I \coloneqq \mathbb{R}$ if $\rho=\infty$. Let $f \colon I \to \mathbb{R}$ be its sum. Then $\int_a^x f = \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{c_{n-1}}{n} (x-a)^n ,$ and the radius of convergence of the series on the right is at least $\rho$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-funcs_1359
nl_statement: Assume $f_n \colon \mathbb{R}\to \mathbb{R}$ are Riemann integrable on every closed bounded interval and converge uniformly on compact subsets to $f \colon \mathbb{R}\to \mathbb{R}$. Prove that for every interval $[a,b]$, the function $f$ is Riemann integrable on $[a,b]$ and $\int_a^b f = \lim_{n\to\infty} \int_a^b f_n .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-funcs_1426
nl_statement: Let $f(x) \coloneqq \sum_{n=0}^\infty c_n (x-a)^n$ converge on $(a-\rho,a+\rho)$. Suppose $f^{(k)}(a)=0$ for all $k=0,1,2,\dotsc$. Prove that $c_n=0$ for all $n$, i.e., $f(x)=0$ on $(a-\rho,a+\rho)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-funcs_1442
nl_statement: For $f_n(x) \coloneqq \dfrac{x}{1+(n x)^2}$, show that $f_n'$ converges pointwise to a function that is discontinuous at $0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-funcs_1556
nl_statement: Let $I,J \subset \mathbb{R}$ be closed bounded intervals with interiors $I^\circ$ and $J^\circ$, and let $(x_0,y_0) \in I^\circ \times J^\circ$. Suppose $F \colon I \times J \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous and Lipschitz in the second variable, i.e., there exists $L \in \mathbb{R}$ such that $\lvert F(x,y)-F(x,z)\rvert \le L \lvert y-z\rvert \quad for all y,z \in J and x \in I .$ Then there exists $h>0$ with $[x_0-h,x_0+h] \subset I$ and a unique differentiable function $f \colon [x_0-h,x_0+h] \to J$ such that $f'(x) = F\bigl(x,f(x)\bigr) \qquad and \qquad f(x_0)=y_0 .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-real-nums_380
nl_statement: Let $S$ be an ordered set and let $A \subset S$ be a nonempty finite subset. Show that $A$ is bounded. Furthermore, show that $\inf A$ exists and belongs to $A$ and $\sup A$ exists and belongs to $A$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-real-nums_2203
nl_statement: Let $b \in \mathbb{N}$ with $b \ge 2$. Prove that for every $\varepsilon>0$ there exists $n \in \mathbb{N}$ such that $b^{-n}<\varepsilon$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_828
nl_statement: Let $R$ be a closed rectangle in $\mathbb{R}^n$ with the length of one of its sides equal to $0$, and let $S$ be a closed rectangle with $R \subset S$. If $f \colon S \to \mathbb{R}$ is bounded and $f(x)=0$ for $x \in S \setminus R$, then show that $f$ is Riemann integrable on $S$ and $\displaystyle \int_S f = 0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_843
nl_statement: Let $R$ and $S$ be closed rectangles in $\mathbb{R}^n$. Suppose $h \colon R \to \mathbb{R}$ is bounded and $h(x)=0$ for $x \notin \partial R$ (the boundary of $R$). Define $\widetilde{h} \colon \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ by $\widetilde{h}(x)=h(x)$ for $x \in R$ and $\widetilde{h}(x)=0$ for $x \notin R$. Show that $\widetilde{h}$ is Riemann integrable on $S$ and $\displaystyle \int_S \widetilde{h} = 0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_891
nl_statement: Let $f \colon \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ have compact support (not necessarily continuous). Suppose $R$ is a closed rectangle such that $\operatorname{supp}(f) \subset R$ and $f$ is Riemann integrable on $R$. Then for every closed rectangle $S$ with $\operatorname{supp}(f) \subset S$, the function $f$ is Riemann integrable on $S$ and $\int_S f = \int_R f .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_904
nl_statement: Let $R$ and $S$ be closed rectangles in $\mathbb{R}^n$. Define $f \colon \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ by $f(x)=1$ if $x \in R$ and $f(x)=0$ otherwise. Prove that $f$ is Riemann integrable on $S$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_939
nl_statement: Let $R$ be a closed rectangle in $\mathbb{R}^n$, and let $(S_j)_{j=1}^\infty$ be closed rectangles such that $S_j \subset R$ and $S_j \subset S_{j+1}$ for all $j$. Suppose $f \colon R \to \mathbb{R}$ is bounded and $f$ is Riemann integrable on each $S_j$. Show that $f$ is Riemann integrable on $R$ and $\lim_{j\to\infty} \int_{S_j} f = \int_R f .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-multivar-int_949
nl_statement: Let $f \colon [-1,1] \times [-1,1] \to \mathbb{R}$ be Riemann integrable and suppose $f(x) = -f(-x)$ for all $x \in [-1,1] \times [-1,1]$. Using the definition, prove that $\int_{[-1,1] \times [-1,1]} f = 0 .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_989
nl_statement: Prove $C([0,1],\mathbb{R})$ is an infinite-dimensional vector space where the operations are defined in the obvious way: $s=f+g$ and $m=af$ are defined as $s(x) = f(x)+g(x)$ and $m(x) = a f(x)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_1015
nl_statement: Let $\mathbb{R}[t]$ be the vector space of polynomials in one variable $t$. Let $D : \mathbb{R}[t] \to \mathbb{R}[t]$ be the derivative operator (derivative in $t$). Show that $D$ is a linear operator.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_1021
nl_statement: Take the space of polynomials $\mathbb{R}[t]$ and define the operator $A : \mathbb{R}[t] \to \mathbb{R}[t]$ by $A\bigl(P(t)\bigr) = tP(t)$. Show that $A$ is linear and one-to-one, but show that it is not onto.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_1086
nl_statement: Show that every convex set in $\mathbb{R}^n$ is connected using the standard topology on $\mathbb{R}^n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2197
nl_statement: Show that if $S$ is any subset of the entries of an $n$-by-$n$ matrix $A$, and $S$ always contains two entries from the same row or always contains two entries from the same column, then the sum of the absolute values of all the terms of the determinant of $A$ that contain only entries from $S$ is less than or equal to the sum of the absolute values of all the terms of the determinant of $A$ that contain the entries in $S$ except for one of them. (This is a purely combinatorial property of the determinant.) Use this to prove that the determinant is a multilinear function in the rows of the matrix, that is, linear in each row separately while fixing the other rows.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2205
nl_statement: Suppose $A = [a_{i,j}]$ is an $n$-by-$n$ matrix. Show that if $A^\prime$ is the matrix obtained by switching column $j$ and $k$ of $A$, then $\det(A^\prime) = - \det(A)$. Similarly, show that if $A^\prime$ is the matrix obtained by switching row $j$ and $k$ for $A$, then $\det(A^\prime) = - \det(A)$. Furthermore, show that if $A$ is a matrix with two equal rows or two equal columns then $\det(A) = 0$. (Do this without resorting to the Laplace formula.)

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2341
nl_statement: Let $X$ and $Y$ be normed vector spaces. Show that if $A,B : X \to Y$ are linear and bounded operators, then $A+B$ is bounded. Also show that if $\alpha \in \mathbb{R}$, then $\alpha A$ is bounded. Show that $\lVert \cdot \rVert_{L(X,Y)}$ is a norm on $L(X,Y)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2368
nl_statement: Let $(X,d)$ be a metric space. Prove that if $x_n \to x$ and $y_n \to y$ in $X$, then $d(x_n,y_n) \to d(x,y)$ in $\mathbb{R}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2398
nl_statement: Let $X$ and $Y$ be normed vector spaces and $A \in L(X,Y)$ a linear operator. Show that if $A$ is one-to-one and onto, then $A^{-1} : Y \to X$ is bounded. (Use the fact that $A$ must have bounded inverse from the open mapping theorem; however, if you do not know this theorem, give a proof assuming completeness of $X$ and $Y$.)

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2407
nl_statement: Let $L : X \to Y$ be a linear operator between normed vector spaces and suppose $L$ is invertible and $L^{-1}$ is bounded. Show that there exists some $\delta > 0$ such that if $\lVert A - L \rVert < \delta$, then $A$ is invertible and $\lVert A^{-1} \rVert \leq \frac{\lVert L^{-1} \rVert}{1 - \lVert L^{-1} \rVert \lVert A - L \rVert} .$ (Use the Neumann series.)

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2416
nl_statement: Let $A$ be a linear operator on $\mathbb{R}^n$. Show that the operator norm on $\mathbb{R}^n$ defined by $\lVert A \rVert = \max \bigl\{ \lVert Ax \rVert : \lVert x \rVert = 1 \bigr\} ,$ is equal to the supremum $\sup\{ \lVert Ax \rVert : \lVert x \rVert \leq 1 \}$, and also equal to the supremum $\sup\{ \lVert Ax \rVert : \lVert x \rVert < 1 \}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2431
nl_statement: Let $\lVert \cdot \rVert$ be any norm on $\mathbb{R}^n$. Show that the induced operator norm on $L(\mathbb{R}^n,\mathbb{R}^m)$ satisfies $\lVert A \rVert = \max \bigl\{ \lVert Ax \rVert : \lVert x \rVert = 1 \bigr\} = \sup \bigl\{ \lVert Ax \rVert : \lVert x \rVert \leq 1 \bigr\} = \sup \bigl\{ \lVert Ax \rVert : \lVert x \rVert < 1 \bigr\} .$ (Use that the unit sphere is compact in finite dimensions.)

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2459
nl_statement: Suppose $A : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^m$ is linear. Show that if $A$ is invertible, then the inverse function $A^{-1} : \mathbb{R}^m \to \mathbb{R}^n$ is linear and bounded. Furthermore, show that the operator norm satisfies $\lVert A^{-1} \rVert \geq \frac{1}{\lVert A \rVert} .$ (Use that $\lVert I \rVert=1$ for the identity.)

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2519
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is differentiable at $x_0 \in \mathbb{R}^n$. Show that if $f$ has a local minimum or maximum at $x_0$, then $Df(x_0) = 0$ (the zero map $\mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$).

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2526
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is differentiable on an open set $U \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ and consider a point $x_0 \in U$. Show that $\lVert Df(x_0) \rVert = \sup \biggl\{ \lim_{t\to 0} \biggl\lvert \frac{f(x_0 + th) - f(x_0)}{t} \biggr\rvert : h \in \mathbb{R}^n, \ \lVert h \rVert = 1 \biggr\} .$ (That is, the operator norm of the derivative equals the best directional derivative bound.)

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2537
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is differentiable at $x_0 \in \mathbb{R}^n$. Show that if $f$ has a local minimum or maximum at $x_0$, then $Df(x_0) = 0$. (That is, the gradient must be zero.)

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2595
nl_statement: Let $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ be differentiable and suppose $Df(x)=0$ for all $x \in \mathbb{R}^n$. Show that $f$ is constant.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2660
nl_statement: Let $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^m$ be differentiable at $x_0 \in \mathbb{R}^n$ and let $A \in L(\mathbb{R}^n,\mathbb{R}^m)$ be linear. Prove that $\lVert f(x_0+h) - f(x_0) - Ah \rVert \leq \lVert Df(x_0) - A \rVert \lVert h \rVert + o(\lVert h \rVert) \quad as h \to 0 .$ (That is, the error compared to a linear approximation by $A$ is controlled by the difference of derivatives.)

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2827
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^m$ is differentiable at $x_0 \in \mathbb{R}^n$. Show that the Jacobian matrix of $f$ at $x_0$ equals the matrix of the linear map $Df(x_0)$ in the standard bases.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2836
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^m$ is differentiable at $x_0 \in \mathbb{R}^n$. Prove that $Df(x_0)$ is unique.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2946
nl_statement: Let $A$ be an $n$-by-$n$ symmetric matrix. Show that there exists an orthonormal basis of $\mathbb{R}^n$ consisting of eigenvectors of $A$, and that $A$ is diagonalizable by an orthogonal matrix.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3034
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is twice continuously differentiable on a convex set $U \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ and $H_f(x)$ is uniformly positive definite on $U$. Show that $f$ is strictly convex on $U$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3057
nl_statement: Let $X$ be a normed vector space. Show that if $f : X \to \mathbb{R}$ is differentiable at $x_0 \in X$ and $f$ attains a local minimum at $x_0$, then $Df(x_0) = 0$ as an element of $L(X,\mathbb{R})$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3200
nl_statement: Let $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ be differentiable. Show that for any $x,h \in \mathbb{R}^n$, $f(x+h) - f(x) = \int_0^1 Df(x+th)h dt .$ (That is, the fundamental theorem of calculus along straight lines.)

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3357
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is differentiable and $\nabla f$ is bounded on a convex set $U$. Show that $f$ is Lipschitz on $U$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3365
nl_statement: Let $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ be $C^1$ on an open set $U$. Show that $f$ is Lipschitz on compact subsets of $U$ if and only if $\nabla f$ is bounded on those subsets.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3420
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is $C^2$ on a convex set $U$. Show that if $H_f(x)$ is bounded on $U$, then $\lvert f(y)-f(x) - \nabla f(x) \cdot (y-x) \rvert \leq \tfrac12 \sup_{\xi\in[x,y]} \lVert H_f(\xi) \rVert \lVert y-x \rVert^2 .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3464
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is twice continuously differentiable on a convex set $U$ and $x_0 \in U$ is such that $H_f(x_0)$ is positive definite. Show that there exists a $\delta>0$ such that for all $x$ with $\lVert x-x_0 \rVert<\delta$, $f(x) \geq f(x_0) + \tfrac12 \lambda_{\min} \lVert x-x_0 \rVert^2 ,$ where $\lambda_{\min}$ is the smallest eigenvalue of $H_f(x_0)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3503
nl_statement: Let $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ be $C^2$ and suppose $H_f(x)$ is bounded for $x$ in a convex set $U$. Show that for $x,h \in U$, $\bigl\lvert f(x+h)-f(x) - \nabla f(x)\cdot h - \tfrac12 h^\top H_f(x) h \bigr\rvert \leq \tfrac12 \sup_{\xi\in [x,x+h]} \lVert H_f(\xi) - H_f(x) \rVert \lVert h \rVert^2 .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3563
nl_statement: Let $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ be differentiable and suppose $H_f$ exists and is bounded on a convex set $U$. Show that $f$ is twice differentiable on $U$ and that the second derivative is continuous.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3730
nl_statement: Let $f : \mathbb{R}^2 \to \mathbb{R}$ be a function such that $\frac{\partial f}{\partial x}$ and $\frac{\partial f}{\partial y}$ exist at all points and there exists an $M \in \mathbb{R}$ such that $\lvert \tfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(x,y) \rvert \leq M$ and $\lvert \tfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(x,y) \rvert \leq M$ for all $(x,y) \in \mathbb{R}^2$. Show that $f$ is Lipschitz with constant $M$ with respect to the $\ell^1$ norm on $\mathbb{R}^2$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3784
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is twice continuously differentiable and $H_f$ is Lipschitz on a convex set $U$. Show that the Taylor remainder of order $2$ is $O(\lVert h \rVert^3)$ uniformly on $U$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3840
nl_statement: Let $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ be differentiable and $H_f$ continuous near $x$. Show that $f(x+h) = f(x) + \nabla f(x)\cdot h + \tfrac12 h^\top H_f(x) h + o(\lVert h \rVert^2)$ as $h \to 0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3851
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is differentiable and $H_f$ exists and is continuous at $x$. Show that the second order Taylor expansion holds at $x$ with remainder $o(\lVert h \rVert^2)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3922
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is $C^2$ and $H_f(x)$ is uniformly positive definite on a convex set $U$. Show that $f$ is strongly convex on $U$ and has a unique global minimizer on $U$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_3991
nl_statement: Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ is differentiable and $H_f$ exists and is continuous at $x$. Show that the second order Taylor formula holds at $x$ with remainder $o(\lVert h \rVert^2)$ as $h \to 0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_4207
nl_statement: Let $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ be $C^2$ in a neighborhood of $x$ and $H_f$ continuous at $x$. Show that the second-order Taylor expansion holds at $x$ with remainder $o(\lVert h \rVert^2)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_4279
nl_statement: Let $f : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}$ be $C^2$ in a neighborhood of $x$. Show that if $H_f$ is continuous at $x$, then the second-order Taylor formula holds at $x$ with remainder $o(\lVert h \rVert^2)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_4555
nl_statement: Suppose $F : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^n$ is $C^1$ on a convex set $U$. Show that $F$ is Lipschitz on compact subsets of $U$ if $DF$ is bounded on those subsets.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_4683
nl_statement: Let $F : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^n$ be differentiable and suppose $DF$ is bounded on a convex set $U$. Show that $F$ is Lipschitz on $U$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_4694
nl_statement: Suppose $F : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^n$ is $C^1$ and $DF$ is Lipschitz on a convex set $U$. Show that $F$ is differentiable and the remainder in the first-order expansion satisfies a quadratic bound.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_4754
nl_statement: Suppose $F : \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}^n$ is $C^1$ with $DF$ Lipschitz on a convex set $U$. Show that the second-order remainder estimate holds: $\lVert F(x+h) - F(x) - DF(x)h \rVert \leq C \lVert h \rVert^2 .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_4773
nl_statement: Follow the strategy below to prove the following simple version of the Picard–Lindelöf existence theorem for first order differential equations at a point. Suppose $f : \mathbb{R}^2 \to \mathbb{R}$ is continuous in a rectangle $R$ around the origin in $\mathbb{R}^2$ and $\lvert f(x,y) - f(x^\prime,y^\prime) \rvert \leq L \bigl( \lvert x-x^\prime \rvert + \lvert y-y^\prime \rvert \bigr)$ for some constant $L$ and all $(x,y), (x^\prime,y^\prime) \in R$. Show that the initial value problem $y^\prime = f(x,y)$, $y(0)=0$, has a unique solution on a sufficiently small interval around $0$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-riemann_626
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ is Riemann integrable. Let $\epsilon > 0$ be given. Then show that there exists a partition $P = \{ x_0, x_1, \ldots, x_n \}$ such that for every set of numbers $\{ c_1, c_2, \ldots, c_n \}$ with $c_k \in [x_{k-1},x_k]$ for all $k$, we have $\lvert \int_a^b f - \sum_{k=1}^n f(c_k) \Delta x_k \rvert < \epsilon .$ Here $\Delta x_k \coloneqq x_k - x_{k-1}$ for each $k$ whenever a partition $P = \{x_0,x_1,\ldots,x_n\}$ is used.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-riemann_672
nl_statement: Show that $f \in \mathcal{R}\bigl([a,b]\bigr)$ if and only if there exists an $I \in \mathbb{R}$, such that for every $\epsilon > 0$ there exists a $\delta > 0$ such that if $P$ is a partition with $\Delta x_i < \delta$ for all $i$, then $\lvert L(P,f) - I \rvert < \epsilon$ and $\lvert U(P,f) - I \rvert < \epsilon$. If $f \in \mathcal{R}\bigl([a,b]\bigr)$, then $I = \int_a^b f$. Here $\Delta x_k \coloneqq x_k - x_{k-1}$ for each $k$ whenever a partition $P = \{x_0,x_1,\ldots,x_n\}$ is used.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-riemann_733
nl_statement: Suppose $a < b < c$ and $f \colon [a,c] \to \mathbb{R}$ is a bounded function. Then $\underline{\int_a^c} f = \underline{\int_a^b} f + \underline{\int_b^c} f \quad and \quad \overline{\int_a^c} f = \overline{\int_a^b} f + \overline{\int_b^c} f .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-riemann_1152
nl_statement: Let $f \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ be a bounded function, $\{ a_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ and $\{b_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ be sequences such that $a < a_n < b_n < b$ for all $n$, with $\lim_{n\to\infty} a_n = a$ and $\lim_{n\to\infty} b_n = b$. Suppose $f$ is Riemann integrable on $[a_n,b_n]$ for all $n$. Then $f$ is Riemann integrable on $[a,b]$ and $\int_a^b f = \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{a_n}^{b_n} f .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-riemann_1393
nl_statement: Suppose $f \colon [a,b] \to \mathbb{R}$ is bounded and has finitely many discontinuities. Prove that $f$ is Riemann integrable and that $\lvert \int_a^b f(x) dx \rvert \leq \int_a^b \lvert f(x) \rvert dx .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-riemann_1483
nl_statement: Suppose $f \in \mathcal{R}\bigl([a,b]\bigr)$, then the function that takes $x$ to $\lvert f(x) \rvert$ is also Riemann integrable on $[a,b]$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-riemann_2488
nl_statement: Show that $e^x$ is \emph{convex}, in other words, show that if $a \leq x \leq b$, then $e^x \leq e^a \frac{b-x}{b-a} + e^b \frac{x-a}{b-a}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-riemann_3470
nl_statement: Let $f \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be a Riemann integrable function with $\int_{-\infty}^\infty \lvert f(x) \rvert dx < \infty$. Let $g \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be continuous and equal to zero outside of the interval $[a,b]$. Show that the \emph{convolution} $(g * f)(x) \coloneqq \int_{-\infty}^\infty f(t)g(x-t) dt$ is well-defined for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-riemann_3576
nl_statement: Let $f \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ and $g \colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be continuous functions, where $g(x) = 0$ for all $x \notin [a,b]$ for some interval $[a,b]$. Suppose $\int_{-\infty}^\infty \lvert f(x) \rvert dx < \infty$. Prove that $\lim_{x \to -\infty} (g * f)(x) = 0, \qquad and \qquad \lim_{x \to \infty} (g * f)(x) = 0 .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_694
nl_statement: Let $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ be a convergent monotone sequence. Suppose there exists a $k \in \mathbb{N}$ such that $\lim_{n\to \infty} x_n = x_k .$ Show that $x_n = x_k$ for all $n \geq k$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_757
nl_statement: Prove that $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ converges if and only if $\{ y_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ converges. Furthermore, prove that if they converge, then $\lim_{n\to\infty} x_n = \lim_{n\to\infty} y_n .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_808
nl_statement: Let $\{ a_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$, $\{ b_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$, and $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ be sequences such that $a_n \leq x_n \leq b_n \quad for all n \in \mathbb{N}.$ Suppose $\{ a_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ and $\{ b_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ converge and $\lim_{n\to \infty} a_n = \lim_{n\to \infty} b_n .$ Then $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ converges and $\lim_{n\to \infty} x_n = \lim_{n\to \infty} a_n = \lim_{n\to \infty} b_n .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_877
nl_statement: Let $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ and $\{ y_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ be convergent sequences and $x_n \leq y_n \quad for all n \in \mathbb{N} .$ Then $\lim_{n\to\infty} x_n \leq \lim_{n\to\infty} y_n .$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_921
nl_statement: If $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ is a convergent sequence such that $x_n \geq 0$ for all $n \in \mathbb{N}$, then $\lim_{n\to\infty} x_n \geq 0.$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_921
nl_statement: Let $a,b \in \mathbb{R}$ and let $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ be a convergent sequence such that $a \leq x_n \leq b \quad for all n \in \mathbb{N} .$ Then $a \leq \lim_{n\to\infty} x_n \leq b.$

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_977
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ converges and $x_n \leq y_n$ for all $n$. Show that $\lim\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n \leq \lim\limits_{n\to\infty} y_n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_1021
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is convergent and $x_n \leq y_n \leq z_n$ for all $n$ with $x_n \to \ell$ and $z_n \to \ell$. Show that $y_n \to \ell$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_1027
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is convergent and $x_n \leq y_n \leq z_n$ for all $n$. If $x_n \to \ell$ and $z_n \to m$ with $\ell < m$, show that $y_n$ is convergent and $\ell \leq \lim\limits_{n\to\infty} y_n \leq m$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_1046
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is convergent and $c \in \mathbb{R}$. Show that $\lim\limits_{n\to\infty} (c x_n) = c \cdot \lim\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_1052
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is convergent and $x_n \not= 0$ for all $n$ with $\lim\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n \not= 0$. Show that $\left\{\dfrac{1}{x_n}\right\}$ converges to $\dfrac{1}{\lim\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_1109
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is convergent and $x_n \geq 1$ for all $n$ with $\lim\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n = x$. Show that $\lim\limits_{n\to\infty} \sqrt[n]{x_n} = \sqrt[n]{x}$ for each fixed $n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_1388
nl_statement: Suppose $x_n \to 0$. Show that $\lim\limits_{n\to\infty} \dfrac{x_{n+1}}{x_n} = 1$ if $x_n < 0$ and $\lvert x_n \rvert$ is decreasing.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_1957
nl_statement: Suppose $\{ x_n \}_{n=1}^\infty$ is a bounded sequence. Show that $\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n \ge \liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_1969
nl_statement: Suppose $\{ x_n \}$ is bounded. Show that $\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} (-x_n) = - \liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$ and $\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} (-x_n) = - \limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_1994
nl_statement: Suppose $\{ x_n \}$ and $\{ y_n \}$ are bounded and $y_n \ge 0$. Show that $\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} (x_n y_n) \ge \left(\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n\right) \left(\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} y_n\right)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2031
nl_statement: Suppose $\{ x_n \}$ is bounded. Show that there exists a subsequence $\{x_{n_k}\}$ with $x_{n_k}\to \limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2038
nl_statement: Suppose $\{ x_n \}$ is bounded. Show that there exists a subsequence $\{x_{m_k}\}$ with $x_{m_k}\to \liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2050
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded. Show that $\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$ and $\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$ are real numbers.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2057
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded. Show that $\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} (-x_n) = - \liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$ and $\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} (-x_n) = - \limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2063
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded and $x_n \le y_n$ for all $n$. Show that $\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n \le \limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} y_n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2076
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ and $\{y_n\}$ are bounded and $y_n \ge 0$. Show that $\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} (x_n y_n) \le \left(\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n\right) \left(\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} y_n\right)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2088
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded and $y_n \ge 0$. Show that $\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} (x_n y_n) \ge \left(\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n\right) \left(\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} y_n\right)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2101
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded and $x_n \le y_n$ for all $n$. Show that $\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n \le \limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} y_n$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2204
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded. Show that the set of cluster points is nonempty and closed.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2211
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded. Show that $\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$ is the supremum of the set of cluster points and $\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$ is the infimum of the set of cluster points.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2223
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ and $\{y_n\}$ are bounded. Show that if $\ell$ and $m$ are cluster points of $\{x_n\}$ and $\{y_n\}$ respectively, then $\ell + m$ is a cluster point of $\{x_n+y_n\}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2248
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded and $y_n \ge 0$. Show that $\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} (x_n y_n) \le \left(\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n\right)\left(\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} y_n\right)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2279
nl_statement: Show that if $\{x_n\}$ is bounded, then $\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$ and $\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$ are real numbers.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2329
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded and $y_n \ge 0$. Show that if $\ell$ and $m \ge 0$ are cluster points of $\{x_n\}$ and $\{y_n\}$ respectively, then $\ell m$ is a cluster point of $\{x_n y_n\}$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2336
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded. Show that $\limsup\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$ equals the supremum of the set of cluster points and $\liminf\limits_{n\to\infty} x_n$ equals the infimum of the set of cluster points.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2612
nl_statement: Suppose $\{x_n\}$ is bounded and $x_n \not= 0$. Show that if the ratio $\dfrac{x_{n+1}}{x_n}$ converges, then the limit is at most $1$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2828
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum_{n=1}^\infty a_n$ converges absolutely. Show that for any rearrangement of the series, the sum remains the same.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2835
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum_{n=1}^\infty a_n$ converges absolutely. Show that any series obtained by grouping terms also converges and has the same sum.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2885
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum_{n=1}^\infty a_n$ converges absolutely. Show that $\sum_{n=1}^\infty \lvert a_n\rvert$ converges and that the sum is at least as large in absolute value as the original sum.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2897
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum_{n=1}^\infty a_n$ converges absolutely. Show that for any $\epsilon>0$ there exists $N$ such that for all $n \ge N$, $\left\lvert \sum_{k=n}^\infty a_k \right\rvert < \epsilon$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2904
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum_{n=1}^\infty a_n$ is absolutely convergent and $\sum_{n=1}^\infty b_n$ is convergent. Show that $\sum_{n=1}^\infty a_n b_n$ converges absolutely provided $\{b_n\}$ is bounded.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2922
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum_{n=1}^\infty \lvert a_n \rvert$ and $\sum_{n=1}^\infty \lvert b_n \rvert$ converge. Show that $\sum_{n=1}^\infty \left( \sum_{k=1}^n a_k b_{n-k} \right)$ converges absolutely.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_2935
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum_{n=1}^\infty a_n$ converges absolutely and $\sum_{n=1}^\infty b_n$ converges. Show that the Cauchy product $\sum_{n=0}^\infty c_n$ with $c_n = \sum_{k=0}^n a_k b_{n-k}$ converges absolutely.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4221
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum_{n=0}^\infty a_n$ and $\sum_{n=0}^\infty b_n$ are two convergent series, converging to $A$ and $B$ respectively. Suppose at least one of the series converges absolutely. Define $c_n \coloneqq a_0 b_n + a_1 b_{n-1} + \cdots + a_n b_0 = \sum_{i=0}^n a_i b_{n-i} .$ Then the series $\sum_{n=0}^\infty c_n$ converges to $AB$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4237
nl_statement: Show that the Cauchy product of two absolutely convergent series is absolutely convergent, and its sum equals the product of the sums.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4250
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum a_n$ and $\sum b_n$ are absolutely convergent series. Show that $\sum c_n$ defined by $c_n = \sum_{k=0}^n a_k b_{n-k}$ converges absolutely and $\sum c_n = (\sum a_n)(\sum b_n)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4256
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum a_n$ converges absolutely and $\sum b_n$ converges. Show that $c_n = \sum_{k=0}^n a_k b_{n-k}$ defines a convergent series with sum equal to the product of sums.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4306
nl_statement: Show that if $\sum a_n$ is absolutely convergent, then for any $\epsilon>0$ there exists $N$ such that for all $n \ge N$, $\left\lvert \sum_{k=n}^\infty a_k \right\rvert < \epsilon$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4325
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum a_n$ converges absolutely and $\sum b_n$ converges. Show that the Cauchy product $\sum c_n$ with $c_n = \sum_{k=0}^n a_k b_{n-k}$ converges and $\sum c_n = (\sum a_n)(\sum b_n)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4369
nl_statement: Show that if $\sum a_n$ converges absolutely and $\sum b_n$ converges absolutely, then $\sum (a_n + b_n)$ converges absolutely.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4382
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum a_n$ is absolutely convergent and $\sum b_n$ converges. Show that $\sum a_n b_n$ converges absolutely if $\{b_n\}$ is bounded.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4395
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum a_n$ and $\sum b_n$ converge absolutely. Show that $\sum c_n$ with $c_n = \sum_{k=0}^n a_k b_{n-k}$ converges absolutely.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4401
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum a_n$ is absolutely convergent and $\sum b_n$ converges. Show that $\sum c_n$ with $c_n = \sum_{k=0}^n a_k b_{n-k}$ converges and equals $(\sum a_n)(\sum b_n)$.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4420
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum_{n=1}^\infty x_n$ is a series with bounded partial sums, $\lambda_n \to 0$, and $\sum \lvert \lambda_{n+1} - \lambda_n \rvert$ converges. Show that $\sum \lambda_n x_n$ converges.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4426
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum x_n$ has bounded partial sums and $\lambda_n \to 0$ with $\sum \lvert \lambda_{n+1} - \lambda_n \rvert$ convergent. Show that $\sum \lambda_n x_n$ converges.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4433
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum x_n$ has bounded partial sums and $\{\lambda_n\}$ satisfies $\sum \lvert \lambda_{n+1} - \lambda_n \rvert$ convergent with $\lambda_n \to 0$. Show that $\sum \lambda_n x_n$ converges.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4445
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum x_n$ has bounded partial sums, $\lambda_n \to 0$, and $\sum \lvert \lambda_{n+1} - \lambda_n \rvert$ is convergent. Show that $\sum \lambda_n x_n$ is convergent.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4470
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum x_n$ has bounded partial sums and $\{\lambda_n\}$ is a sequence with $\lambda_n \to 0$ and $\sum \lvert \lambda_{n+1} - \lambda_n \rvert$ convergent. Show that $\sum \lambda_n x_n$ converges.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4489
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum x_n$ has bounded partial sums and $\{\lambda_n\}$ satisfies $\lambda_n \to 0$ and $\sum \lvert \lambda_{n+1} - \lambda_n \rvert$ convergent. Show that $\sum \lambda_n x_n$ converges.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4577
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum x_n$ has bounded partial sums and $\lambda_n \to 0$, and $\sum \lvert \lambda_{n+1} - \lambda_n \rvert$ convergent. Show that $\sum \lambda_n x_n$ converges.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4602
nl_statement: Suppose $\sum_{n=1}^\infty x_n$ has bounded partial sums, $\lambda_n \to 0$, and $\sum \lvert \lambda_{n+1} - \lambda_n \rvert$ convergent. Show that $\sum \lambda_n x_n$ converges.

name: jirilebl_ra_ch-seq-ser_4836
nl_statement: Let $\{b_n\}$ be a sequence with $b_n > -1$ for all $n$. Show that ${(1+b_n)}^n \ge \dfrac{n(n-1)}{2} b_n^2$ for all sufficiently large $n$.

name: benmckay_top_topology_17
nl_statement: Prove that \(W\) is not Zariski open.

name: benmckay_top_topology_124
nl_statement: Prove that the intersection of any closed sets is closed.

name: benmckay_top_topology_134
nl_statement: Prove that union of finitely many closed sets is closed.

name: benmckay_top_topology_137
nl_statement: Prove that the empty set and \(X\) are closed subsets of any topological space \(X\). In particular, sets can be \textit{both} open and closed (sets are \textit{not} doors).

name: benmckay_top_topology_142
nl_statement: Suppose \(A \subset X\) is a subset of a topological space \(X\). Prove that \(\overline{A}\) is closed.

name: benmckay_top_topology_142
nl_statement: Suppose \(A \subset X\) is a subset of a topological space \(X\). Prove that \(A \subseteq \overline{A}\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_148
nl_statement: If \(A \subset X\) is a subset of a topological space \(X\), prove that \(\overline{A}=\bigcap C\) where the intersection is taken over all closed sets \(C\) containing \(A\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_151
nl_statement: Suppose \(A,B\) are subsets of a topological space \(X\). Prove that if \(A \subseteq B\), then \(\overline{A} \subseteq \overline{B}\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_154
nl_statement: Suppose \(A\) is a subset of a topological space \(X\). Prove that \(x \in \overline{A}\) if and only if every open neighborhood of \(x\) meets \(A\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_154
nl_statement: Suppose \(A\) is a subset of a topological space \(X\). Prove that \(A \subseteq \overline{A}\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_154
nl_statement: Suppose \(A\) is a subset of a topological space \(X\). Prove that \(\overline{A}\) lies inside any closed set containing \(A\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_178
nl_statement: Prove that every basis \(S\) of \(\mathbb{R}^{n}\) contains an infinite set \(T \subset S\) so that \(S - T\) is also a basis.

name: benmckay_top_topology_184
nl_statement: Prove that the topology of \(\mathbb{R}^{n}\) has a countable basis.

name: benmckay_top_topology_235
nl_statement: Prove that if \(X\) is a topological space and \(A \subset X\) is dense in \(X\), then any two continuous functions \(f,g : X \to Y\) into a Hausdorff space \(Y\) which agree on \(A\) must be equal.

name: benmckay_top_topology_242
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a Hausdorff topological space and \(C \subset X\) a closed subset. Prove that if \(f : C \to \mathbb{R}\) is continuous and \(\delta >0\), then there exists a continuous function \(g : X \to \mathbb{R}\) so that \(|g(x)-f(x)|\le \delta\) for all \(x \in C\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_252
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be any topological space, and suppose that \(C \subset X\) is closed and that \(U \subset X\) is open. Prove that there is a continuous function \(f : X \to \mathbb{R}\) so that \(f(x)=1\) for all \(x \in C\) and \(f(x)=0\) for all \(x \in X-U\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_255
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a metric space and \(C \subset X\) a closed set. Prove that there is a continuous function \(f : X \to \mathbb{R}\) so that \(f(x)=0\) for all \(x \in C\) and \(f(x)>0\) for all \(x \in X-C\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_262
nl_statement: Suppose \(X\) and \(Y\) are topological spaces and \(A \subset X\) is dense. Prove that the inclusion of \(C(Y) \to C(X \times Y)\) is an isomorphism onto the functions which are constant on each set \(\{x\} \times Y\) with \(x \in X\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_269
nl_statement: Suppose \(X\) is compact and \(f : X \to Y\) is continuous. Prove that each of the following properties of \(f\) holds: (1) \(f\) is closed: if \(A \subset X\) is closed, then \(f(A) \subset Y\) is closed. (2) \(f\) attains its maximum and minimum on \(X\); that is, there exist \(x_{0},x_{1} \in X\) so that \(f(x_{0}) \le f(x) \le f(x_{1})\) for all \(x \in X\). (3) If \(Y=\mathbb{R}\), then \(f\) is uniformly continuous.

name: benmckay_top_topology_329
nl_statement: If \(A \subset X\) is a subset of a topological space \(X\), then the closed subsets of \(A\) in the subspace topology are exactly the sets \(A \cap C\) for any closed set \(C \subset X\). Moreover, the closure of a subset \(S \subset A\) inside \(A\) is the intersection of \(A\) with the closure of \(S\) in \(X\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_335
nl_statement: Let \(S \subset \mathbb{R}^{n}\) be a subset. Prove that the shortest path from \(x\) to \(y\) in \(\mathbb{R}^{n}-S\) is a polygon with corners on \(S\) whenever this makes sense.

name: benmckay_top_topology_352
nl_statement: Suppose \(X\) and \(Y\) are topological spaces and that \(A \subset X\). Suppose as well that \(f : X \to Y\) is a function. Prove that each of the following conditions are equivalent: (1) \(f\) is continuous. (2) The restriction \(g : A \to Y\) is continuous for any open subset \(A\) of \(X\). (3) The restriction \(g : A \to Y\) is continuous for any closed subset \(A\) of \(X\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_352
nl_statement: Suppose \(X\) and \(Y\) are topological spaces and that \(A \subset X\). Suppose as well that \(f : X \to Y\) is a function. Prove that if \(A \subset X\) is dense and the restriction \(g: A \to Y\) is continuous, then \(f\) is continuous.

name: benmckay_top_topology_390
nl_statement: The Zariski topology is not Hausdorff.

name: benmckay_top_topology_404
nl_statement: Suppose that \(f: X \to Y\) is a continuous bijection from a topological space \(X\) to a Hausdorff space \(Y\). Prove that the inverse \(f^{-1}:Y \to X\) is continuous.

name: benmckay_top_topology_407
nl_statement: Suppose a topology on the set \(Y\) is given as the final topology from functions \(f_{i}: X_{i} \to Y\) where \(i\) runs through an index set \(I\). Prove that \(Y\) is Hausdorff if and only if the function \(P : X \to Y\) is injective for some topological space \(X\) and function \(P : X \to Y\) which includes all the functions \(f_{i}\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_418
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a Hausdorff topological space. Prove that if \(C \subset X\) is closed and \(U \subset X\) is open with \(C \subset U\), then there exists an open set \(V \subset X\) so that \(C \subset V\) and \(\overline{V} \subset U\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_420
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a Hausdorff topological space. Prove that if \(x \in X\) and \(U \subset X\) is open with \(x \in U\), then there exists an open set \(V \subset X\) so that \(x \in V\) and \(\overline{V} \subset U\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_422
nl_statement: Suppose \(X\) is a Hausdorff topological space and \(C \subset X\) is closed. Prove that there exists a continuous function \(f : X \to [0,1]\) so that \(f(x)=1\) for all \(x \in C\) and \(f(x)=0\) for all \(x \in X-U\) whenever \(U \subset X\) is an open neighborhood of \(C\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_429
nl_statement: Suppose \(X\) is a topological space and \(C \subset X\) is closed, that \(U \subset X\) is open and contains \(C\), and that a function \(f : X \to [0,1]\) is continuous, and that \(f(x)=1\) for all \(x \in C\) and \(f(x)=0\) for all \(x \in X-U\). Prove that for any open set \(V\) with \(C \subset V \subset \overline{V} \subset U\), we have \(f^{-1}[0,1] \subset V\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_430
nl_statement: Suppose \(X\) is a Hausdorff topological space and \(C \subset X\) is closed. If \(f : X \to \mathbb{R}\) is continuous and \(f(x)=1\) for all \(x \in C\) and \(f(x)=0\) for all \(x \in X-U\) where \(U \subset X\) is open with \(C \subset U\), prove that there exists a continuous function \(g : X \to \mathbb{R}\) so that \(|g(x)-f(x)| \le \delta\) for all \(x \in X\) and some \(\delta > 0\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_436
nl_statement: Prove that a topological space \(X\) is compact if and only if any open cover \(X=\bigcup_{i \in I}U_{i}\) admits a finite subcover; that is, there exists a finite subset \(J \subset I\) so that \(X=\bigcup_{i \in J}U_{i}\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_436
nl_statement: Prove that a closed subset of a compact space is compact.

name: benmckay_top_topology_438
nl_statement: Prove that \([a,b]\subset \mathbb{R}\) is compact for any \(a \le b\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_441
nl_statement: Prove that if \(X\) is a compact topological space and \(f : X \to \mathbb{R}\) is continuous, then there exists \(x_{0},x_{1} \in X\) so that \(f(x_{0}) \le f(x) \le f(x_{1})\) for all \(x \in X\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_441
nl_statement: Prove that if \(X\) is compact and \(f : X \to Y\) is continuous, then \(f\) is closed.

name: benmckay_top_topology_441
nl_statement: Prove that if \(X\) is compact and \(f : X \to \mathbb{R}\) is continuous, then \(f\) is uniformly continuous.

name: benmckay_top_topology_444
nl_statement: Prove that a metric space \(X\) is compact if and only if \(X\) is sequentially compact.

name: benmckay_top_topology_448
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a metric space. Prove that if \(S \subset X\) is closed and bounded, then \(S\) is compact.

name: benmckay_top_topology_451
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a metric space and suppose that \(X\) is sequentially compact. Prove that every open cover of \(X\) admits a finite subcover.

name: benmckay_top_topology_467
nl_statement: Every locally bounded function \(f : X \to \mathbb{R}\) on a compact topological space \(X\) is bounded.

name: benmckay_top_topology_472
nl_statement: If \(X\) and \(Y\) are topological spaces, prove that \(X \times Y\) is compact if and only if \(X\) and \(Y\) are both compact.

name: benmckay_top_topology_474
nl_statement: Let \(X\) and \(Y\) be compact topological spaces. Prove that every open cover of \(X \times Y\) has a finite subcover.

name: benmckay_top_topology_479
nl_statement: Prove that every product of topological spaces is compact if and only if a product of compact topological spaces is compact.

name: benmckay_top_topology_486
nl_statement: Prove that any open cover of \(X \times Y\) has a finite subcover whenever \(X\) is compact and \(Y\) is any topological space, provided that each open set of the cover can be expressed as a union of sets of the form \(U \times V\), where \(U \subset X\) and \(V \subset Y\) are open sets in \(X\) and \(Y\), respectively.

name: benmckay_top_topology_495
nl_statement: Topological spaces \(X\) and \(Y\) are both compact just when their product is compact.

name: benmckay_top_topology_500
nl_statement: Prove that if \(S \subset \mathbb{R}^{n}\) is compact, then \(S\) is closed and bounded.

name: benmckay_top_topology_530
nl_statement: In any Hausdorff space, every compact set is closed.

name: benmckay_top_topology_531
nl_statement: Prove that the closure of any open set need not be open.

name: benmckay_top_topology_531
nl_statement: Prove that the closure of any closed set need not be closed.

name: benmckay_top_topology_531
nl_statement: Prove that the boundary of an open set need not be closed.

name: benmckay_top_topology_531
nl_statement: Prove that the boundary of a closed set need not be open.

name: benmckay_top_topology_531
nl_statement: Prove that the boundary of a subset need not be empty.

name: benmckay_top_topology_539
nl_statement: Let \(X\) and \(Y\) be topological spaces. Prove that if \(f : X \to Y\) is continuous and \(K \subset X\) is a compact subset, then the restriction \(f|_{K}:K \to Y\) is a closed map.

name: benmckay_top_topology_542
nl_statement: Suppose \(X\) and \(Y\) are topological spaces and that \(X\) is compact and that \(f : X \to Y\) is a continuous bijection. Prove that \(f\) is a homeomorphism.

name: benmckay_top_topology_545
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a Hausdorff topological space and \(Y\) any compact topological space. Prove that the first projection \(X \times Y \to X\) is a closed map.

name: benmckay_top_topology_551
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a topological space. Prove that \(\overline{A \cup B} = \overline{A} \cup \overline{B}\) for all subsets \(A,B \subset X\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_551
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a topological space. Prove that for any subset \(A \subset X\) and open set \(U \subset X\), we have \(\overline{A \cap U} \subseteq \overline{A} \cap U\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_551
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a topological space and let \(A,B \subset X\). Prove that \(\overline{A} - \overline{B} \subseteq \overline{A-B}\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_556
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a topological space. Prove that \(\left(A \times B\right)^{\circ}=A^{\circ} \times B^{\circ}\) and that \(\overline{A} \times \overline{B} = \overline{A \times B}\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_559
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a topological space. Prove that a subset \(A \subset X\) is dense in \(X\) if and only if \(\overline{A}=X\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_567
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a topological space and let \(A \subset X\) be any subset. Prove that the boundary of \(A\) equals the closures of \(A\) and \(X-A\) intersected: \(\partial A = \overline{A} \cap \overline{X-A}\).

name: benmckay_top_topology_572
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a topological space and let \(A \subset X\). Prove that if \(A \subset A^{\circ}\), then \(A\) is open.

name: benmckay_top_topology_572
nl_statement: Let \(X\) be a topological space and let \(A \subset X\). Prove that if \(A^{\circ} \subset A\), then \(A\) is closed.

name: benmckay_top_continuity_7
nl_statement: If \(X\) and \(Y\) are subsets of Euclidean space, prove that this agrees with the usual definition.

name: benmckay_top_continuity_12
nl_statement: Suppose that \(X\) and \(Y\) are sets equipped with the cofinite topology. Prove that a map \(f \colon X \to Y\) is continuous just when each point has finite preimage.

name: benmckay_top_continuity_16
nl_statement: Prove that a map \(f \colon X \to Y\) is continuous just when the preimage of any closed set is a closed set.

name: benmckay_top_continuity_40
nl_statement: Prove that constant maps are continuous.

name: benmckay_top_continuity_51
nl_statement: The composition \(g \circ f\) of any continuous maps \(f \colon X \to Y\) and \(g \colon Y \to Z\) is continuous.

name: benmckay_top_continuity_77
nl_statement: Prove that the restriction of a continuous map to any set is continuous.

name: benmckay_top_continuity_80
nl_statement: Let \(X\) and \(Y\) be topological spaces and let \(\{X_a\}_{a\in A}\) be open subsets of \(X\) whose union is \(X\). Prove that a map \(f \colon X \to Y\) is continuous if and only if for every \(a\in A\) the restriction \(\left.f\right|_{X_a} \colon X_a \to Y\) is continuous.

name: benmckay_top_continuity_84
nl_statement: Let \(X\) and \(Y\) be topological spaces.
